title: %HP true damage shouldn't exist, change my mind.
body: There straight up should not be a type of damage in this game that is 100% uncounterable no matter what you do. That's stupid, anti-fun and has absolutely no place in a game branding itself as needing strategy to win. If something has no counter strategy than it should not exist.

replies.body: % HP true damage is not inherently bad, but using it too frequently or adding too much of it into a kit is not a good idea. It should exist as an incentive for risky plays or fulfilling specific requirements.

if vayne W only dealt true damage during her ult, I would probably be fine with it.

but since it doesnt, and it always deals true damage, and all vayne has to do is hit you 3 times ( {{item:3124}} makes it 2 lul) then fighting vayne is never fun

combine it with her kit and how painfully hard she counters melee champs (Q reposition, Q+R stealth on low CD, E self peel + possible stun on a lowish CD, passive means that once they try to disengage that you get to chase for free) and you can see why a large portion of the playerbase of League hates vayne

I agree, Vayne hasn't always been a damage problem.  IMO she's most balanced when her W is treated as secondary damage and you max Q or W is upgraded first mainly to fluff it up. The counter strategy, get this, isn't to build against it. It's to *play* against it. Fiora without her ult is the easiest example, you just need to actively keep your weakest side away from her. Even when she Ults, you can deny her a single vital just by standing in a wall. Vayne's a little trickier, because her play around isn't in 1v1s, especially since both Fiora and Vayne are duelists. Her play around is in teamfights, where you need to get her to switch targets, or where you can abuse her short range to lock her down.

The main thing Rageblade does, which is the problem, is that it lowers the time it takes for Vayne to proc her things. This gives her a better late game, but it's because she has less of a window to force her to switch targets before she gets that damage. I think that's where the problem lays, that Vayne has lost some of the 'play around' she should have because of RageBlade.

Your idea about counter-playing instead of counter-building is smart, but wrong. 

Counter-plays refer situation-specific acts. For example, the way to counter Nasus is to deny him from stacking. This is a strategy that is very exclusive to playing against Nasus. Another example, the way to counter Renekton is not to go in when his fury bar is red because it gives him a huge boost in trading power. This is also very specific to playing against Renekton.

Now, back to your case of Fiora. Suppose Fiora's vitals are changed to dealing bonus physical damage instead of max HP % damage. Does that change the way you play against her? No, you still have to prevent her from hitting your vitals.

Therefore your argument is wrong in a sense that it has nothing to deal with Fiora having max HP % damage. It a champion design issue. Playing against a champion's strength universally applies to any matchup, and has NOTHING to deal with max HP % damage.

But the difference between fiora doing physical/true damage is this. 

A tank could just stack like 500 armor and facetank fiora ultimate without a problem. No counterplay would be required whatsoever. The presence of true damage prevents this.

And that’s why Conqueror, BC and Last Whisper exist.

But Fiora's % max health true damage is hardly a niche. It's just kinda there.

Like, she's only a tank shredder *because* she has % max health true damage. If it was just % max health damage, she wouldn't be a tank shredder unless she built to be.

You could slap % max health true damage on literally any champion and say "there's your tank shredder, it's intended".

Fiora, as a champion got designed to be a grand duelist who basically should win duels vs anybody after getting some items, but her weakness is basically being truly useless in teamfights. I won't argue if design like that is good or not, but that is point of her.

Fiora got her true %hp damage not because devs thought "lets just put it here and see how it works lul". It's here so she could melt tanks and squishies at similar rate, without being too skewed for any of them. Let's imagine that Fiora gets on vitals:

1. **very big ad scaling**: Fiora burst squishies hard and is unable to do much vs tanky characters (not even true tanks) without both {{item:3071}} and{{item:3036}}, but as a melee squishy bruiser she can't afford to buy both of these
2. ** Physical %Max Hp**: Fiora can't deal well with squishies unless her ratio is overtuned, and her tank melting isn't bad, but it isn't on par with champions like Kog or even Tristana.
3. **Magical %Max Hp**: Fiora work great in early, but after some time in game she starts to suck dramatically due to lack of avalaible MPen for her. Basically a reverse to her current power curve, which shouldn't happen
4. **True damage with Ad scaling**: Fiora burst squishies very very hard while working good vs armor tanks (Malph, Rammus) but being bad vs HP/Sustain tanks (Sion, Maokai).
5. **Physical %max Hp with bonus % armor pen**: would work very similar as current Fiora tbh, but her numbers would need be bigger (due to loss of true damage) so she would kill squishies even better.

So, the point is that Fiora %max hp true damage exists not because devs are monkeys, it exists so her dueling potential is similar against every kind of opponent, which is 101 of her intended design. Im not saying that im fan of %max hp true damage, but any other option would either require BIG overbuffing in order to fulfill her fantasy, or she would be champion with much more weaknesses than strengths.

Truly useless in teamfights right ?
(stare at fiora's R)
Yes.

Yes, because in a teamfight there's no way in hell she should be getting her R off fully.

And even compared to other champions that aren't that great in teamfights, Fiora brings **very** little to the table in a teamfight. She's a relatively squishy DPS melee who doesn't have real burst of any kind and has no backline access. All she has to offer is a potential heal from ult that isn't even necessarily going to happen and a potential stun from her W. A juggernaut can serve amazingly as an anti-diver/anti-assassin, and can function as a frontline. An assassin can remove high-priority targets from the field. Most other divers and skirmishers have reliable CC or backline access, or at least reliable team-wide utility.

Fiora can win a 1v1 against basically anyone, but having nothing reliable to contribute in a teamfight means she's pretty useless in one.

True damage is useful when you want damage that is effective against hard targets without instantaneously popping soft targets.

%HP damage is used when you want a damage source that scales through the game without being too strong early or too weak late.

True %hp damage then is useful when you want a damage source that's target agnostic.  It doesn't matter who you're hitting or what point in the game it is, it will always be equally useful.

True %HP damage then should be used on champs with short to medium range who have relatively low target selection since they often can't pick who they are dueling.

It is ok when it is implemented in a certain way.  Like a short range small % over time that you can just move away from.  Or if it is on an item that results in giving up power in items in order to counter build a problem on an opposing team.  The problem is when they saturate the game with too many sources of it or make too many large % hits that are hard to avoid.

It has a place when limited and done within reason.  Too bad it went well beyond that point a long time ago.
